did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Peter Marshall and Catherine Marshall Papers 1927-1964 1933-1956

persname.part: Marshall, Peter, 1902-1949
Marshall, Catherine, 1914-1983

did.abstract: Presbyterian clergyman and chaplain of the United States Senate (Peter Marshall). Author (Catherine Marshall). Correspondence, notes, and sermons of Peter Marshall, and drafts, galleys, scrapbooks, movie scripts, and other papers about Marshall collected by his wife, Catherine Marshall.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The papers of Peter Marshall, Presbyterian clergyman and chaplain of the United States Senate, and his wife, Catherine Marshall, author, were deposited in the Library of Congress by Catherine Marshall LeSourd in 1964 and converted to a gift in 1970. Additional gifts were received, 1968-1969.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of Peter Marshall and Catherine Marshall were arranged and described in 1966 and expanded in 1979 and 1985. The finding aid was revised in 2013.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Sound recordings and television tapes have been transferred to the Library's Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division where they are identified as part of these papers.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Peter Marshall and Catherine Marshall in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Peter Marshall and Catherine Marshall are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

altformavail.head: Microfilm
altformavail.p: A microfilm edition of these papers is available on six reels. Consult a reference librarian in the Manuscript Division concerning availability for purchase or interlibrary loan. To promote preservation of the originals, researchers are required to consult the microfilm edition.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container or reel number, Peter Marshall and Catherine Marshall Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Peter Marshall (1902-1949) and Catherine Marshall (1914-1983), husband and wife, span the years 1927-1964, with the bulk of the material concentrated in the period 1933-1956. Personal materials of Peter Marshall comprise about a fourth of the collection, including a small amount of correspondence and a large file of notes for his sermons. The sermons, about 850 in number, cover the period 1933 through January 1948 and include such well-known sermons as “Singing in the Rain,” “Go Down Death,” “Under Sealed Orders,” “The King is in the Audience,” and “Rendezvous in Samarra.” There are also synopses of many of the sermons and various indexes that list the sermons by title, date, location, subject matter, and quotations used. The collection is organized into seven series: Peter Marshall: Sermons , Peter Marshall: Correspondence , Catherine Marshall: Correspondence , Catherine Marshall: Book and Article File , Scrapbooks , Addition I , and Addition II .

Catherine Marshall's papers, in addition to treating her own career as an author and lecturer following the death of her husband, are mainly oriented to the life of Peter Marshall and to her biography of him, A Man Called Peter. Most of her correspondence consists of mail from persons who read her numerous books and saw the motion picture based on the biography.

A significant portion of the papers concerns the production by Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation of A Man Called Peter. There are verbatim records of the conferences attended by Catherine Marshall and representatives of Twentieth Century-Fox during planning of the film. In addition to many versions of the film script, these records present the metamorphosis of the work from printed page to celluloid. Important correspondents include screenwriter Eleanor Griffin, producer Samuel G. Engel, and the film's principal performers, Richard Todd, Jean Peters, and Marjorie Rambeau.
Also in the collection are other manuscripts of Catherine Marshall's published works, some of which include both original drafts and corrected copies of proofs.

The Scrapbooks series is composed mainly of printed material including some correspondence relating to Peter Marshall's election as chaplain of the United States Senate, his death, and Catherine Marshall's subsequent career as an author. Addition I and Addition II contain miscellaneous sermons and ideas for sermon, written prayers, seminary papers of Peter Marshall, and other material.
An appendix to this finding aid lists the names and dates of correspondents in the Peter Marshall: Correspondence series of the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in seven series:

item.ref: Catherine Marshall: Book and Article File

scopecontent.p: Texts of sermons by Peter Marshall and related material.

arrangement.p: Organized into two groups and arranged as filmed, with Group 2 preceding Group 1. Numbers to sermons were assigned by Marshall. Includes various indexes.

scopecontent.p: Family letters and general correspondence of letters sent and received by Peter Marshall. Names and dates of correspondents are listed in an appendix .

arrangement.p: Arranged by type and therein chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received by Catherine Marshall.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically, with travel correspondence organized according to location and miscellany filed at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Trips to Scotland (1951), Hollywood, Calif. (1957), Natchez, Miss., California, and Europe (1958)
Catherine Marshall: Book and Article File

scopecontent.p: Drafts and production material of Mrs. Marshall's published books and articles and an unpublished work. The manuscript of A Man Called Peter also contains papers concerning the movie version of the work.

did.unittitle: Requests to quote from Catherine Marshall's books
“Journal of a Trip to Scotland,” unpublished

scopecontent.p: Mainly biographical material about Peter Marshall and publicity relating to the books and movie about him.
